DOC.brief_summary: The investigator propose test hypothesis place perineural catheter continuous peripheral nerve block , inject initial local anesthetic bolus via insertion needle result faster-onset sensory block inject initial bolus via perineural catheter . The study result help define optimal local anesthetic bolus introduction technique—needle versus catheter—for peripheral nerve block place perineural catheter .
DOC.brief_title: Continuous Infraclavicular Nerve Blocks : Needle Versus Catheter Local Anesthetic Bolus
DOC.detailed_description: Specific Aim : The investigator propose test hypothesis place perineural catheter continuous peripheral nerve block , inject initial local anesthetic bolus via insertion needle result faster-onset sensory block inject initial bolus via perineural catheter . The study result help define optimal local anesthetic bolus introduction technique—needle versus catheter—for peripheral nerve block place perineural catheter .
DOC.criteria: age ≥ 18 year willing bilateral infraclavicular blocks/catheters place current daily analgesic use opioid use within previous 4 week neuromuscular deficit either upper extremity body mass index > 30 kg/m2 weight < 50 kg [ 100 lbs ] pregnancy incarceration
